forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely. Cloudy, with a low around 54. South southwest wind around 12 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. South wind 12 to 21 mph, with gusts as high as 31 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a half and three quarters of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the darkened sky blankets Downtown San Francisco, the soft patter of rain sings a familiar lullaby. Tonight, the wind gently whispers from the south, swirling around at a brisk pace, colliding with the dampened streets below, where the lingering chill enhances the city’s romantic allure. The air, saturated with promise, suggests a cloud cover that will tease the view of the Golden Gate and obscure the twinkling city lights, making the landscape appear muted and mysterious. With temperatures hovering around a cool 54 degrees, the city is inviting but undeniably brisk.

Looking ahead to Monday, residents can expect a continuation of this damp tapestry, with the rain intensifying as the day unfolds. Temperatures will fluctuate but will remain in the comfortable embrace of mid to upper 50s. The promise of significant rainfall looms, perhaps laying the foundation for a cozy day indoors. As the city dons its foggy cloak, perfect for a leisurely stroll along Market Street or perhaps a visit to one of the local bakeries, you may want to reach for a sturdy jacket and an umbrella, ensuring a warm and dry exploration of the day's mysteries. While the forecast might lead one to hide away, the beauty of a rainy day in San Francisco offers its own charm—a moment to reflect, engage with art, or simply enjoy a good book by a window, letting the rhythmic rain be your background symphony.
